addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable S
r
Francis Walsingham knight, principall Secretary to her Ma
tie
.

15 Aprill
1589
From M
r
Thomas Bodleigh.

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
H. since
e sealing of
e inclosed, comming in place, where
Barnevelt
was, uppon occasion of speeche between us
for
e losse of
Gertrudenbergh,
of himself he
requested me to enter into communication w
t
him about
e redresse of all maters to
e sa-
tisfacti
o
of her
Ma
tie
and
e contrey: whiche
I told him I had long desired, and would
appoint any time,
at he should best like. W
at
further talke passed between us,
e soddaine
departure of this bearer, can not affourd me
e leasure to signifie at this p
nt
. But I
finde him very weary, of
at course
at he
hath taken, and I stand in hope to do a great
deale of good.
15 A
p
Yo
r
H. most humbly bound, Tho. Bodley
